newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Monday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Turnover fell to 2.5 billion yuan from 4.8 billion last Friday, with the seven-day contract the most active.
Traders said the turnover fell today with many institutions reducing their borrowing after last week's active trading on heavy demand for year-end settlement funds.
"Some financial institutions did less business today, because they had already bought enough funds in the last week for the annual settlement," said one trader.
"The seven-day contract became the most active one because there are still some institutions which have not finished the financial settlement," said another trader.
